basics.name: Miguel Garcia
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: An aspiring Senior computer scientist interested in Software Development and motivated to always learn new frameworks and innovative solutions

work.name: Goldman Sachs
work.summary: Oversaw deployments and maintained internal infrastructure as part of a DevOps/Runtime Engineering team. and Implemented best practices and automation strategies, reducing downtime and improving system reliability whilefostering a collaborative and growth-oriented work environment.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Texas A&M University, College Station, Texas

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Kanji Learning App
projects.summary: Kanji learning app, teaches users to write kanji correctly. WIP.

projects.name: Predictive Medical Model
projects.summary: Optimized data for machine learning models, utilizing advanced techniques to ensure high data quality. Evaluated multiple predictive models, employing rigorous methodologies to select the most accurate model. Fine-tuned model hyperparameters and utilized statistical analysis in order to ensure high accuracy.

projects.name: CPU Simulator
projects.summary: Led a team of 4 to develop a functioning simulator of an x86 CPU.Successfully converted machine level instructions into C functions and expressions. Devised each simulated step of a processor from the Fetch stage up to the Program Counter stage

projects.name: KANM Student Radio Website
projects.summary: Coordinated with a team of 10 to develop a working UI for the A&M student radio club website utilizing React JS. Developed working front-end components with Figma to envision user interface design.
